source_sentence: 不空羂索神變真言經卷第四
translation: Bukong juansuo shenchang zhenyan jing, roll 4

source_sentence: 大唐天竺三藏菩提流志譯
translation: Bodhiruci Transliteration of the Tripiṭaka of the Great Tang Dynasty

source_sentence: 祕密印三昧耶品第四之二
translation: Chapter IV.2 of the Samaya of the Esoteric Seal
seal of accomplishment
"He joins his palms with his second hand inside the large open palm.
He bends his head fingers and his two ring fingers.
They bend their heads flat and lean against each other.
The two middle fingers are slightly bent, and the heads are closed.

source_sentence: 出二頭指二無名指頭上一節。
translation: He takes out his two first fingers and two ring fingers and places them one knuckle above his head.
He puts his two thumbs together and slightly bends them.

source_sentence: 頭去二頭指側面一寸四分。
translation: They go one inch and four minutes to the side of the second digit.
He raises each of his two pinky fingers.

source_sentence: 搏無名指側相去二寸印真言。
translation: He wrestled the sides of his ring finger away from each other for two inches and sealed the true saying.

source_sentence: 唵(一)覩嚕覩嚕(二)鉢(二合)頭米(三)旖暮伽(上)悉地(四)[合*牛](五)是印三昧持結之者。
translation: "Om (1) Tuolumu Tuolumu (2) Prabhākaramitra (3) Yamogha (above) Siddhi (4) [Hop*Niu] (5) This is a seal of samādhi that's adhered to.
Avalokitêśvara Bodhisattva quickly bestows it.

source_sentence: 旖暮伽王出世間法皆當成就。
translation: King Kumbhâṇḍa's transmundane dharmas will all be accomplished.
His merits will increase and he'll be praised by others.
He'll be protected by all the gods and goddesses.

source_sentence: 金剛蓮花心印覆右手掌。
translation: He covers his right palm with the mudrā of the vajra lotus.
He tilts his left palm up.
He puts the backs of his two hands together.

source_sentence: 右小指叉左大拇指岐間。
translation: He crosses his right pinky between the fingers of his left thumb and the fingers of his right thumb.

source_sentence: 右大拇指叉左小指岐間。
translation: The right thumb crosses the bridge of the left pinky.

source_sentence: 左右頭指各急屈掌中左右中指。
translation: The left and right index fingers each bend sharply in the palm, and the left and right middle fingers.
The ring fingers are each joined together.
Stretching them out, he puts his hand back.
He places his seal over his mind and sits correctly with his body upright.

source_sentence: 心如金剛淨念不動印真言。
translation: With his mind like adamant, he purifies his mind with the seal of Akṣobhya, which says.

source_sentence: 唵(一)旖暮伽(上)紇(二合)唎娜野(二)鉢(二合)頭米(三)陀(上)囉陀(上)囉(四)鉢(二合)頭麼陀(上)囉(五)摩訶漫拏攞紇唎娜野(六)[合*牛](七)此印三昧彼結持者。
translation: "Om (1) 陰暮伽(上)紇(二合)ﻲ野(2) 鉢(二合)头米(3) 陀(上)拉陀(上)拉(4) 鉢(二合)首麼陀(上)拉(5) 摩哈漫拿攞紇(ﻲ野(6)[合*牛](7) This seal of samādhi is held by those who are bound to it.

source_sentence: 誦祕密心真言一七遍者。
translation: He recites the true words of the esoteric mind one or seven times.
He'll achieve the accomplishment of the accumulation of all the preparatory qualities.
The sign of the lasso
He covers his left hand with his palm at the bottom of his heart.
He bends his thumb toward his palm.
The tip goes one inch below the palm.

source_sentence: 其頭指中指無名指小指。
translation: He bends his head finger, middle finger, ring finger, and pinky finger.
Each finger slightly bends its head.
The four fingers are each separated by an inch.
It's like a lotus leaf.
He tilts his right hand up.
He puts his palm on the back of his left hand.
It's seven inches.
The thumb is bent toward the palm.
He bends his head toward his palm one inch, and his middle finger bends his head.
It's at the level of the thumb.
The back of the nail is one inch apart.
He bends his head finger, ring finger, and pinky finger.
He bends it slightly toward his palm.
He seals the true saying.

source_sentence: 唵(一)播輸(去)播底播捨陀(上)囉(二)捨跢娑(去)訶(去)塞囉(三)囉濕弭(四)跛(二合)囉底漫抳跢迦野(五)旖迦(二合)唎灑抳(六)菩陀(上)儞三(去)菩陀(上)泥(七)步嚕步嚕(八)旖暮伽(上)播捨悉悌(九)[合*牛](十)此印三昧彼持結者。
translation: Om (1) Pāśu (depart) Pāti Pāśādha (supra) Rā (2) Śākyesa (depart) Ha (depart) Serā (3) Rāśmī (4) Lumbinī (2) Rāti Manoṭṭi (4) Kakano (5) Yajñadhara (6) Bodhisena (supra) Nimi (depart) Bodhisena (supra) Nimi (7) Pūrṇu Pūrṇu (8) Yamogha (supra) Pāśa Siddhi (9) [Hop*Niu] (10) This seal samādhi is held by those who are bound.
One recites the mother dhāraṇī [sūtra].
He applies the one seal of blessing.
He takes his right hand and throws it outward.
He throws it three times.
He holds his left hand in place.
He also recites the True Saying of the Esoteric Essence seven times.
Then, he dissolves the mudrā.

source_sentence: 由是則攝阿耨菩提三昧種智。
translation: Thus, he gathers the seed wisdom of the concentration of Anavatapta.
It abides in consciousness.
Where he'll be born, he'll attain the characteristics of a great man.
All the gods and goddesses love, protect, and look at them.

source_sentence: 十方諸佛菩薩喜樂觀視。
translation: The buddhas and bodhisattvas in the ten directions delight in watching them.
Avalokitêśvara Bodhisattva prides himself on his lotus position and praises him.

source_sentence: 於無始劫謗讟正法大邪見罪皆得除滅。
translation: Since beginningless time, the great vice of denigrating the right Dharma and mistaken views has been removed.
The merit that accrues is like seeing my body.
It's like Mount Sumeru.
The seal of the great jeweled banner
He joins his palms together inside his large open palm.
He raises his two ring fingers and closes his two pinkies.
They close their heads together in a straight line.
He bends the heads of each of his two middle fingers.

source_sentence: 押二無名指側上第一文。
translation: He puts his two ring fingers on their sides at the top of the first block.
He causes the heads to be separated by two parts.
He bends the heads of the two forefingers to lean on each other.
He holds each of the two thumbs to the side of the head finger.
Stretching his arm straight up, he puts his seal on top of his head.
The seal truly says.

source_sentence: 唵(一)窒(二合)[口*履]野特(能邑反下同音二合)婆(無何反下同)努誐跢(二)避詵者都(三)薩縛窒(二合)[口*履]野特(二合)婆(四)避曬階(五)鉢(二合)頭麼播抳(六)素(蘇古反)鉢(二合)頭米(七)旖暮祇(虬曳反)薩縛嚲詑誐跢(八)地瑟恥諦[合*牛](九)此印三昧持結之者。
translation: Om (1) 窒(二合)[口*履]野特(能邑反下同音二合)婆(無何反下同)努oga(二)避詵者都(三)萨縛窒(二合)[口*履]野特(二合)婆(四)避曬階(五)鉢(二合)頭麼婆抳(六)素(蘇古反)鉢(二合)頭米(七)陰暮祇(虬曳反)萨縛举 测 测 测 测 测 测 测 测 测 测 测 测 测(八)迪瑟恥諦[合*牛](九)其印三昧持其結。

source_sentence: 則同十方一切如來手授灌頂。
translation: It's the same as the consecration given by the hands of all the tathāgatas in the ten directions.

source_sentence: 又問觀世音菩薩手授灌頂。
translation: He also asks Avalokitêśvara Bodhisattva to confer the consecration by hand.

source_sentence: 當所生處證真言仙大轉輪王三昧耶。
translation: "Where will he be born and realize the true language sage, the great wheel-turning king samādhi?
Attaining this nonempty king samādhi is manifest.
He destroys the afflictive hindrances and removes their liberation.
Their birthplace in the world will be blessed with unlimited life.'
The sign of the king of fury
He closes his palms together and opens his palms.

source_sentence: 二中指二無名指二小指。
translation: The two middle fingers, two ring fingers, and two pinkies are placed together like bending the head.
The tips of each are placed close to each other as if bending.
They're separated by half an inch.

source_sentence: 二頭指各搏中指側中節。
translation: Each of the two index fingers grabs the middle knuckle of the middle finger on its side.
They bend upward like a hook.
He raises each of the two thumbs and connects them.
They are separated from each other by half an inch.
He places them on top of his seal.
He raises his eyebrows and looks up.
He makes a big fuss.
He looks to his left and right.
He seals the true words.

source_sentence: 唵(一)矩嚕陀(上)囉惹(二)摩訶(去)暮伽(上三)歌那歌那(四)薩縛訥瑟吒(上)[合*牛](五)此印三昧能摧一切惡天龍神一切惡人。
translation: Om (1) Kuruṭa (above) Rāja (2) Mahā (departed) Muga (above) Kona Kona (4) Svāhunaṭa (above) [ha*niu] (5) This seal of meditation destroys all evil gods, dragons, spirits, and all evil people.
It can subdue bad thoughts.
It can also destroy Sumeru the king of mountains.
Those are the evil Vināyaka gods.
All of their retinues are subdued themselves.

source_sentence: 一切諸天沙門婆羅門毘舍首陀。
translation: All the gods, ascetics, priests, and piśācītika gods rejoice and pay homage to him.
They rejoice and pay homage to him, accomplishing all the teachings.
The seal of Tārā Bodhisattva
He joins his palms with his open palms inside.
With his second hand, he bends his ten fingers slightly.
They touch each other with their heads together.
He seals the mantra.

source_sentence: 唵(一)鉢頭(二合)麼跢[口*(隸-木+士)](二)覩嚕覩嚕(三)[合*牛](四)此印三昧亦能成就一切事業。
translation: Om (1) 鉢頭(二合)含翱[口*(隸-木+士)] (2) と嚕と嚕 (3) [合*牛] (4) This seal of meditation is also capable of accomplishing all undertakings.
The seal of the Bodhisattva Avalokitêśvara, the Great White One
Putting his palms together, he opens his palms one inch below the ground.

source_sentence: 二頭指二中指二無名指。
translation: He puts his two forefingers, two middle fingers, and two ring fingers together.
They each stand straight up and close their heads together.
He raises each of his two thumbs.
They are held one inch apart at the side of the head finger.
The two pinkies each stand up and are slightly flexed.
They are separated by eight parts at the head.
He seals with the true saying.

source_sentence: 唵(一)摩訶(去)鉢頭(二合)米(二)濕廢譡倪(三)虎嚕虎嚕(四)莎縛訶(五)此印三昧能集眾法速證成就。
translation: Om (1) mahā (deprecated) bowlhead (2) rice (2) śrāvastī (3) huru huru (4) svāhā (5) This seal of meditation is a quick-realization accomplishment of the collection of all dharmas.
(4) Vikrūṭa-bodhisattva seal

source_sentence: 合掌二中指二無名指二小指。
translation: He joins his palms with his two middle fingers, two ring fingers, and two little fingers.
Each one stands straight up and joins his head.

source_sentence: 二頭指各[打-丁+必]在中指無名指岐間。
translation: Each of the two index fingers [hit-ding+b] is placed between the gums of the middle and ring fingers.
They rest their heads on each other.
He puts his two big toes together and extends them.
He puts them on the middle knuckle of his two middle fingers.
They close their mouths, cut their teeth, pin their brows, and protrude their eyes.
He looks angrily at them.
He seals with the true words.

source_sentence: 唵(一)苾(二合)[口*履]矩胝(上)鉢頭(二合)米(二)跢囉跢囉(三)[合*牛](四)此印三昧摧伏一切能滿諸願。
translation: Om (1) bhikṣu (2) [mouth*cupiter] kuṭi (above) pattra (2) rice (2) karu (3) [ha*niu] (4) This seal of samādhi destroys all and fulfills all vows.
White Body Avalokitêśvara Mother Bodhisattva Seal

source_sentence: 是白身母印同前大白觀世音印。
translation: "This is the same great white Avalokitêśvara mudrā as the preceding one.
The seal truly says.

source_sentence: 唵(一)鉢頭(二合)麼(二)半拏囉縛枲儞(三)矩努(知古反)矩努(同上四)莎縛訶(五)一切天神印合腕相著。
translation: Om (a) padou (b) mo (b) panaravāsinī (c) kunu (cognitive consciousness) kunu (ditto) svāh (e) the sign of all the gods joins his wrists and touches them together.
He bends his two middle fingers flat and bends his head against each other.
The other eight fingers are scattered and jagged apart.
They are separated by an inch from each other.
He bends his head at a general angle.
Don't touch your head to each other.
He seals with the true saying.

source_sentence: 唵(一)旖暮祇(虬曳反)鉢(二合)頭麼(二)縛羅禰(三)悉[亭*夜]悉[亭*夜][合*牛](四)是印三昧召諸天神。
translation: Om (1) 陰暮祇(虬曳反)鉢(二合)头麼(2) 縛羅禰(3) 悉[亭*夜]悉[亭*夜][合*牛](4) This seal of samādhi summons the gods and goddesses to stay inside the altar and joyfully protect him.
They rejoice and support him while he's staying at the altar.
The sign of the messenger of all buddhas
He puts his palms together inside his empty palms.
It's like a lotus flower that's yet to open.
He seals the true saying.

source_sentence: 唵(一)薩縛怛囉(二合)誐弭儞(二)旖皤歌野(三)澇(盧告反)[寧*吉](寧吉反)唎(二合)抳[合*牛](四)是印三昧召諸天女藥叉使者。
translation: Om (1) Śavatara (2) Gaḍīnī (2) Gajapati (3) Jāṅgulan (Luguṇa) [Ning*ji] (Ningji) Ārya (2) Ārya (2) Āmrapāli (4) This seal samādhi summons the goddesses and yakṣa messengers.
They all come to meet and abide.
The seven tārā goddesses' mudrās
He presses his palms together.
He bends his two thumbs into his palms.

source_sentence: 各正捻無名指根第一文。
translation: Each correctly twists the first text of the root of the ring finger.
Each takes the first finger, ring finger, and pinky finger.
He quickly grasps his thumb in an upward fist.
He bends the head of each of the two middle fingers slightly.
They are separated by half an inch.
He seals the true saying.

source_sentence: 唵(一)旖暮祇(虬曳反)儞(二)跢嚟哆囉耶(三)鉢頭(二合)麼步臡(如兮如)[合*牛](四)此印三昧能伏一切眾惡天神。
translation: Om (1) 陰暮祇 (虬曳反) 訪問 (2) 冗嚟哆羅耶 (3) 鉢頭 (二合)麼步 杭 (如兮如) [合*牛] (4) This seal of meditation can subdue all the evil celestials.
It protects the altar worship.
Hayagrīva Avalokitêśvara mudrā
He joins his palms and opens his palms.
He bends his two forefingers into his palm.
He makes them touch his back.
He puts his two thumbs together and sends them up.
He puts them on the middle knuckle of his two forefingers.
He seals the words with his mouth.

source_sentence: 唵(一)度嚕(二)跢嚕攞(三)鉢頭(二合)米(四)旖暮祇(虬曳反)[合*牛](五)此印三昧於諸法中最為奇勝。
translation: Om (1) Duru (2) Kuru (3) Pāturu (2) Mi (4) Yamogi (Ghoṣamati) [H*Niu] (5) This seal of meditation is the most extraordinary of all teachings.
(4) The sign of the raising of the vajra and the mudrā
He joins his palms and opens his palms.
He removes each of his two middle fingers.
[Ta - d + b] Puts it on the first knuckle on the head finger.
They touch each other's heads.

source_sentence: 二頭指頭各拄二無名指側上。
translation: The tips of the two head fingers each rest on the sides of the two ring fingers.

source_sentence: 二大拇指相並邪申微竪向上。
translation: He puts his two thumbs together and slightly raises them upward.
He seals with the true words.

source_sentence: 唵(一)縛拏縛目谿(二)儞訖(二合)藺跢野(三)訥瑟吒(上)[合*牛](四)是印三昧能契一切金剛明法。
translation: Om (1) Vana-vamukha (2) Negi-kha (2) Rājagṛha (3) Neṣṭha (above) [H*Niu] (4) This seal of concentration can match all the teachings of vajra-dhāra.
It's a seal of samādhi that protects the speedy manifestation of all samādhis.
Blue-necked Avalokitêśvara Seal
He joins his palms and opens his palms.
He bends his two thumbs into his palms.

source_sentence: 二頭指各握大拇指上節。
translation: He grasps the upper knuckle of the thumb with each of his two head fingers.

source_sentence: 二中指二無名指二小指微屈頭相拄。
translation: The two middle fingers, two ring fingers, and two pinkies are slightly bent at the head to support each other.
He seals with the true words.

source_sentence: 唵(一)鉢頭米(二合)儞攞建制(尼例反二)濕(二合)縛(三)囉步嚕步嚕[合*牛](四)此印三昧能祐成就一切三昧。
translation: Om (1) 鉢頭米(二合)訪問攞建制(尼例反二)濕(二合)縛(三)罗步埔嚕[合*牛](4) This seal of meditation protects the accomplishment of all samādhis.
Eleven-faced Avalokitêśvara mudrā
He presses his palms together.
Bend each of the two thumbs horizontally in the palm.

source_sentence: 各以頭指中指無名指小指。
translation: With each, he uses his first finger, middle finger, ring finger, and little finger.
He grasps his thumbs and makes a fist.
Their fists and faces are pressed together.
With his face and eyes aglow, he gives rise to the mind of great compassion.
He seals the true words.

source_sentence: 唵(一)譟[名*養](名養反)婆(無可反)娜泥(二)跛(二合)囉枲娜(三)舍縒野[合*牛](四)此印三昧能祐成就一切明法。
translation: Om (1) ṇḍanta [nam*yang] (namyang anti) bhāva (no ko anti) nirde (2) Ṛṣipatana (3) śaṃsano [ha*niu] (4) This seal of samādhi protects the accomplishment of all insightful qualities.
It's unobstructed, and it's the sign of the Ishūra Heaven.
He joins his palms with his open hand.

source_sentence: 二中指二無名指二小指。
translation: He puts his two middle fingers, two ring fingers, and two little fingers together.
They close their heads together.
He bends each of the two forefingers.
He puts his middle finger on the side of his middle knuckle like a hook.
He places his two thumbs four inches apart.
They are slightly crooked.
He places his head eight inches from the tips of his two fingers.
He seals with the true saying.

source_sentence: 唵(一)鉢(二合)頭米濕(二合)縛[口*履](二)娑(去)陀(上)野[合*牛](三)此印三昧召集一切伊首羅天。
translation: Om (1) pa (2) dhumis (2) v [mouth * foot] (2) sah (go) dhātu (up) nyā [ha * ox] (3) This seal of meditation summons all the Īśvara gods.
They all come to meet and stay, and they protect them.
Mahêśvara celestial seal

source_sentence: 准前印改左頭指竪微屈。
translation: Following the preceding sign, he changes his left forefinger to stand up and slightly bend.
He modifies it by placing the two middle fingers on top of each other.

source_sentence: 押二無名指側上第一文。
translation: He puts his two ring fingers on their sides and places the first text on top.
He seals with the true words.

source_sentence: 唵(一)旖暮祇(虬曳反)濕縛[口*履](二)[合*牛](三)此印三昧治罰一切弊惡鬼神。
translation: (1) Om (1) Ganmugil (虬曳反)濕縛[口*履] (2) [合*牛] (3) This seal of meditation subdues all bad and evil spirits.

source_sentence: 焰摩王印(舊云閻羅王訛也)
translation: The seal of King Yama (formerly known as the Yama king's mudrā)
He uses his second hand and eight fingers.
He puts his right hand over his left hand into his palm and hooks it together with a cross.
They touch each other with their fingertips.
The two thumbs are each erect and jutted apart.
They are slightly flexed, half an inch apart.
They should first urgently face up toward the head.
He then places them above his heart.
He raises and lowers his thumbs.
He seals with the true words.

source_sentence: 唵(一)縒麼[口*履](二)跢唎跢唎(三)吽(四)此印三昧召請焰摩王。
translation: Om (1) 縒麼[口*履] (2) 冗沛沛 [口*履] (3) 吽 (4) This seal samādhi invites King Yama.
He comes to sit at the assembly and joyfully protects and guards him.
Water Celestial Seal
He tilts his left hand up with his palm at the bottom of his left mother's room.
He bends his five fingers slightly like a lotus leaf.
With his right hand, he covers his palm with his heart.

source_sentence: 大拇指小指各竪屈掌中。
translation: The thumb and pinky fingers each stand up and bend in the palm.

source_sentence: 頭指中指無名指各散磔開。
translation: The forefinger, middle finger, and ring finger each spread out and separate.
He slightly flexes his head about an inch apart.
He seals with the true words.

source_sentence: 唵(一)娜誐(二)鉢(二合)頭弭儞(三)吽(四)此印三昧呼召一切諸大龍王。
translation: (1) Om (1) nāga (2) po (2) dharma (3) un (4) this seal samādhi summons all the great dragon kings.
They all come to the altar party and joyfully support him.
Vaiśravaṇa-gallop seal
"The second hand is held together back to front.

source_sentence: 二頭指二中指二無名指二小指。
translation: He puts his two head fingers, two middle fingers, two ring fingers, and two pinkies together.
They are each hooked backwards and fingertips are placed face to face.
He straightens his two thumbs.
They are cut off to the outside.
First, he turns sharply to the right and then puts them to the center of his head.
He seals the true saying.

source_sentence: 唵(一)藥[起-巳+乞]灑(二合)地鉢底(二)素嚕素嚕(三)[合*牛](四)此印三昧摧破一切藥叉鬼神惡心散壞。
translation: Om (1) yakṣa [ki - si + ki] sā (2) ti padi (2) suru suru (3) [h*niu] (4) this seal of meditation destroys all yakṣa spirits and scatters their bad thoughts.
The sign of the king of the Brahman-heaven
He aligns his left hand with the preceding watery celestial seal.
He bends his right hand at the elbow.
It should be aligned with the shoulder blade.
The thumb is slightly bent toward the palm.
He bends his head finger slightly.
It's one inch from the tip of the thumb.

source_sentence: 中指無名指小指直竪相並。
translation: The middle finger, ring finger, and pinky finger should be straight and joined together.
He seals with the true words.

source_sentence: 唵(一)旖暮祇(虬曳反二)沒(二合)囉[可*欠](二合)麼(三)嚕底(丁禮反)吽(四)此印三昧能現梵天一切天法。
translation: (1) 唵 (1) 陰暮祇 (虬曳反二) 没 (二合) 囉 [可*欠] (二合) 相 (3) 嚕底 (丁禮反) 吽 (4) 此印三昧能現出婆天一切天法。
Seal of the Sage Who Undergoes Suffering
He makes the sign of the Paranirmita-vaśavartin King.
He changes the forefinger and thumb of his right hand.
He raises his middle finger and extends it.
He bends his pinky finger like a hook.
He seals with the true words.

source_sentence: 唵(一)[口*履]使縛囉禰(二)旖暮伽(上三)步臡(同上)[合*牛](四)此印三昧召集一切苦行明仙。
translation: Om (a) [muzzle*track] Mudrā (b) Varuṇa (c) Bumogha (d) [ha*niu] (d) This seal of samādhi summons all ascetics and sages of knowledge.
He joins his palms in salutation, praises, comforts, and venerates them.

source_sentence: 毘瑟怒天輪印(舊云那羅延天)
translation: Vaiśravaṇa celestial wheel mudrā (formerly known as the Nārāyaṇa celestial)

source_sentence: 合掌右手五指各散磔開。
translation: He joins his palms and spreads his five fingers apart with his right hand.

source_sentence: 左手頭指中指無名指小指。
translation: On the left hand, he raises his head finger, presses his middle finger, and raises his ring finger and pinky finger.

source_sentence: 叉入右手頭指中指無名指小指中節岐間。
translation: He forks his right hand between the middle finger of his head finger, middle finger, ring finger, and middle knuckle of his pinky.
He takes them out.
He takes the four fingers of his right hand and spreads them apart.
He puts the tip of his left four fingers between the fingers of his right hand and the middle finger, ring finger, and pinky.
It's placed between the fingers of the right hand and the fingers of the fifth finger.

source_sentence: 左大拇指押右頭指節上右大拇指直竪。
translation: He puts his left thumb on the knuckle of his right head finger, and his right thumb goes straight up.
He seals the true saying.

source_sentence: 唵(一)旖暮祇(虬曳反二)弭瑟拏囉(三)鉢(二合)頭麼那髀(四)娑(去)囉縒漫嚲步臡(五)莎縛訶(六)此印三昧能摧一切阿素洛眾敬伏馳散。
translation: Om (1) kamogi (gnarly) (2) vaiḍṇara (3) pa (2) dumāna thigh (4) svāh (go) lākuma (5) svāh (6) This seal of meditation is capable of destroying all the asuras, chasing them away with reverence, and scattering them.
Seal of the Mahêśvara Heaven
Bend your left hand at the elbow.
He tilts his palm forward.
He makes a gesture with his five fingers to hold the great fruit.
With the right hand bent at the elbow, it should be aligned with the shoulder blade.
The thumb twists the top of the little fingernail.
The first finger, middle finger, and ring finger should be raised.
Each finger is jutted open.
He seals the true saying.

source_sentence: 唵(一)嚕捺(二合)囉覩徵(上二)弭理莎縛訶(三)此印三昧能摧一切瘧鬼食精氣鬼皆怖馳散。
translation: Om (1) rudraka (2) tuṣita (2) vṛji svāhā (3) This seal of meditation destroys all malaria spirits, and food and breath spirits are scattered in fear.
(3) This seal of meditation destroys all feverish demons, eats semen, and scatters them with fear.
The head finger of the right hand goes straight up.
He bends his thumb horizontally in the middle of his palm.
He takes his middle finger, ring finger, and pinky finger.
He sharply clenches them into a fist.
The left hand is the same as the right hand.
He puts his right fist sideways against his waist.
He points his head forward.
He puts his left fist to his side and puts it over his heart.
He puts it sideways over his heart.
Pointing his head outward, he indicates it.
He looks angrily at them and becomes very angry.
He seals the true saying.

source_sentence: 唵(一)鑠訖底(二合)陀(上)嚟(二)旖暮伽(上)縛底(三)莎縛訶(四)此印三昧降伏一切作障鬼神。
translation: Om (1) 鑠デデ (2) ấtta (2) śamogha (3) svāhā (4) This seal of meditation subdues all obstructive spirits.

source_sentence: 日天子印(梵云阿昵底耶)
translation: The sign of the sun-ruler (Sanskrit: aniruddha)
He puts his second hand up at the side of his palm and touches it.
He puts his two thumbs across the middle of his palm.

source_sentence: 各屈頭指押大拇指上節。
translation: He bends his head finger to pin the upper knuckle of his thumb.

source_sentence: 二中指二無名指二小指。
translation: He puts his two middle fingers, two ring fingers, and two pinkies together.
Each is placed alongside the other and slightly bent toward the palm.
He seals the true saying.

source_sentence: 唵(一)娑(去)[可*欠]塞(二合)囉計囉臡(二)[合*牛]都理(三)莎縛訶(四)此印三昧能放百千光明日天祐護。
translation: Om (1) Śa (go) [ko * u] sai (2) Łaklógraphe (2) [ha * niu] tuili (3) Śavahā (4) This seal of samādhi emits a hundred thousand rays of light, which are protected by the sun gods.
moon-deva-zi (Sanskrit word sumati)
He tilts his palms in front of him.
Putting them side-to-side, they touch each other.
He raises each thumb and extends it.
He raises each of his two forefingers and slightly bends them.

source_sentence: 二中指二無名指二小指。
translation: He bends his middle finger, two ring fingers, and two pinkies.
Each is bent into a fist.
He seals it with the true words.

source_sentence: 唵(一)素麼(二)跛(二合)囉髀[合*牛](三)此印三昧為諸星天照曜護持。
translation: Om (1) sumati (2) lame (2) rāth [h*niu] (3) This seal samādhi is guarded by the stars and gods shining brightly.
Bhagavān, this is the seal of meditation.
Each one of them can accomplish all deeds.
It can extinguish all disasters, misfortunes, and hindrances.

source_sentence: 而廣莊嚴旖暮伽王廣大解脫蓮花曼拏羅三昧耶。
translation: Vairocana-samādhi is a lotus-flower maṇḍala samādhi that adorns King Kumbhâṇḍa in great measure and is vastly liberating.
This is a practitioner who always cleans his body and bathes his clothes.
His body is always clean and bathed, and his clothes are fragrant and pure.
He should eat pure food.
He arouses great compassion for all sentient beings.
He respects the superior preceptor.

source_sentence: 心恒尊重恭敬供養觀世音菩薩摩訶薩。
translation: He always respects and venerates Avalokitêśvara Bodhisattva Mahāsattva in his mind and makes offerings to him.
Accepting and upholding this teaching, he seeks the Buddha's enlightenment.
Don't engage others who aren't engaged in the same activity.
Don't engage others who aren't your own preceptor.
Nor should you engage others who don't know the Dharma.
Those who don't seek bodhi.
They should create a mixed bag of teachings and present the realm of explanation.
Always cultivate it intensely and in silence.
Rubbing incense on his hands with a scent.
He burns incense, makes offerings, and seals it with a wheel.
He maintains the violating samādhi of not revealing the bonds.

source_sentence: 隨一一印三昧耶相觀照同現。
translation: Following each seal, the samaya's characteristics are observed and illuminated together.
He recites it three times.

source_sentence: 作法持誦懺悔發願行道禮讚。
translation: He recites the ritual, repents, renews his vows, practices the path, and pays homage and praises it.

source_sentence: 日日獲得百千俱胝數倍功德諸大福聚。
translation: Day by day, he'll obtain hundreds of thousands of corpuscles of several times the merit of those great merit accumulations.

source_sentence: 當為十方一切如來諸大菩薩。
translation: They'll be the great bodhisattvas of all the tathāgatas in the ten directions.
They'll confer ordination and record their accomplishments.
All the gods will rejoice and protect them.
They'll obtain the greatest offerings in the world.

source_sentence: 具足成就一切陀羅尼真言壇印三昧耶。
translation: They will fully accomplish the dhāraṇī altar seal samaya of all true words.
Where he'll be born, his life won't be disastrous.

source_sentence: 獲得不空悉地大真言明仙輪王三昧耶。
translation: He obtains the nonempty accomplishment of the great true language, the sage wheel-turning king samaya.
He has great wisdom and eloquence.

source_sentence: 而於一切天仙大眾演說此法。
translation: He explains this teaching to all the celestials and the public.
He attains great fearlessness and is respected by everyone.

source_sentence: 當於觀世音菩薩會中生育。
translation: He'll give birth in the assembly of Avalokitêśvara Bodhisattva.

source_sentence: 若命終時身心寂靜如入禪定。
translation: If his body and mind are still at the end of his life, he'll enter meditative concentration.

source_sentence: 遂得一切諸佛菩薩摩訶薩。
translation: He then attains the status of one of the buddhas, bodhisattvas, and mahāsattvas.
One time, they'll call out to him, saying, "Truly, truly, the son of the Buddha!
'Come to my land!
'My land is your place of birth.'
From this birth onward, you'll reach bodhi.
You'll never again fall into the three bad destinies.
You'll be born, never subject to the wet transformation of womb and egg.
Your life span will never falter.
From one buddha-stage to another, you'll be born with the lotus flower's knowledge of past lives.
Padmasaṃbhava's born with knowledge of past lives.
Chapter 5 of the Dharma Realm's Esoteric Seal Adornment

source_sentence: 世尊此廣大解脫蓮華曼拏羅三昧耶種種手印。
translation: "The Bhagavān has these various handseals of the vast liberating lotus maṇḍala samaya.
These vessel and weapon seals are vast and immeasurable.
It's like the great earth.
It's a fertile base for all sentient beings.
It's like the tathāgata's omniscience.
All sentient beings rely on that knowledge for their fulfillment.
If someone is pleased with that, then they'll know that person has ceased many sins.
You should know that person has ceased all sins.
In this samādhi, he'll attain its accomplishment.
Suppose someone who purifies it abides in the mind of great compassion.
He memorizes the pure precepts and observes the restraints of true speech.

source_sentence: 受持讀誦不空羂索心王母陀羅尼真言三昧耶。
translation: He memorizes, recites, and reads the true-speaking samādhi of the Amoghapāśa Heart King Mother Dhāraṇī.
He seeks unsurpassed correct perfect enlightenment.
If he can follow the teaching.

source_sentence: 圖畫廣大解脫蓮花曼拏羅印三昧耶。
translation: He should draw a vast liberation lotus maṇḍala seal samaya.
He accepts, upholds, and makes offerings.
He observes all the samādhis in accordance with it.
He diligently cultivates the characteristics of them all.
You should know that person to be like a great wheel-turning king.
He's fully endowed with the seven treasures and has measureless powers.
He guides and transforms the four continents.
Wherever he goes, all sentient beings are subdued and honored.
None of them are subjugated and honored.

source_sentence: 一切毘那夜迦藥叉羅剎惡神鬼等。
translation: All the bad spirits and ghosts of Vairocana, Yakṣa, and Rāṣṭrapāla will submit themselves and rejoice.
They then subdue themselves and become joyous.
Sometimes they are destroyed, and then they run away.
They're also freed from conspiracies and ambiguities.

source_sentence: 無始重罪一切病惱亦皆壞滅。
translation: Their heavy sins and all illnesses and afflictions from beginningless time are also destroyed.
The Bhagavān thus explains this teaching.
He teaches it for the sake of attaining the well-being of sentient beings.

source_sentence: 為得成就一切三摩地故說。
translation: He teaches it for the sake of attaining the accomplishment of all the samādhis.
He teaches it for the sake of removing all the hindrances of sins.

source_sentence: 為降伏一切惡鬼神故說。
translation: He teaches it for the sake of subduing all evil spirits.
He teaches it for the sake of attaining enlightenment for all bodhisattvas.
It's said for the sake of causing all bearers of the true words.

source_sentence: 發生種種三昧智觀相應慧解故說。
translation: It's said in order to produce the wisdom and understanding associated with the various samādhis and contemplations.

source_sentence: 令得遍依廣大解脫蓮華壇印一切三昧耶一切相狀。
translation: It causes them to completely rely on the lotus altar seal of vast liberation for all samaya and all its characteristics.

source_sentence: 圖畫一切廣大解脫蓮華壇。
translation: He illustrates the lotus altar with all the vast lotus flowers of liberation.
It's spread out on a lotus flower dais.

source_sentence: 圖畫一切手印諸器仗印一切寶花果印者。
translation: It's a picture of all the hand signs, all the container seals, and all the precious flower and fruit seals.
They are all surrounded by the firelight and brilliance of the mudrās.
The lotus flowers, their branches, stems, and leaves are arranged in color.
They're all covered with color and shape.
All the marks resemble the marks of birth.
They are all beautiful and sublime.

source_sentence: 所謂執一切寶果印執一切金剛果印。
translation: They're called the sign of appropriating all the precious fruits and the sign of appropriating all the vajra fruits.

source_sentence: 執三股金剛杵印執寶箭印。
translation: He's holding the sign of the three-pronged vajra hammer and the sign of the precious arrow.

source_sentence: 執曼拏唎印執金剛蓮花印。
translation: He's holding the seal of the maṇḍala and executing the seal of the vajra lotus.

source_sentence: 執蓮花鬘印執跋楞伽印。
translation: He appropriates the sign of the lotus-flower garland and appropriates the sign of the vāraṇga.

source_sentence: 執跋折囉跛囉瑟恥多印執濕縛娑印。
translation: He takes the sign of the vajra-limbo-thrata and the sign of the Śivasa.
He bestows the sign of fearlessness, the sign of flicking his fingers and praising him.
He makes the sign of the fist and the sign of the period mark.
He makes the sign of the clasped hands and the sign of the hook before he only receives the offer.
He takes the sign of the lock, the sign of the prison, and the sign of the hand of contemplation.
He takes the seal of contemplation and the seal of the jeweled hand.

source_sentence: 執善金剛杵印執不空蓮花印。
translation: He takes the sign of the good vajra and pounder and the sign of the nonempty lotus.
He takes the sign of the vajra bell and the sign of the sword.
He takes the sign of the trident and executes the sign of the pounder.
He wields the sign of the jeweled warrior and the sign of the flower gall.
He takes the sign of the cord and executes the sign of the large fish.
He wields the sign of the jeweled wheel and the sign of the jeweled conch.

source_sentence: 執無緣果印執石榴果印。
translation: He takes the sign of the fruit without a causal link and executes the sign of the pomegranate fruit.
He appropriates the sign of the moon and appropriates the sign of the sun.
He wields the sign of the hammer and carries the sign of the poplar branch.
He wields the sign of the precious flower and carries the sign of the number of pearls.

source_sentence: 執五股金剛杵印不空羂索手印。
translation: He wields the sign of the five-pronged vajra and the sign of the nonempty khāsā hand.
He makes the sign of Amoghapāśa's accomplishment.
These are the hand signs.
They all point to the upper part of the wrist.
They are each painted with a seven-jeweled ring and a variety of adornments.
He follows them with his hand.
He seals it with the true saying.

translation: 唵(一)旖暮伽(上二)漫惹唎(三)弭利旨利(四)[合*牛](五)唵(一)旖濕(二合)縛縒野(二)乞灑拏弭誐底(丁禮反三)[合*牛](四)唵(一)皤野縛囉禰(二)覩置(三)[合*牛](四)唵(一)薩縛嚲詑誐跢(二)地瑟(二合)恥羝(三)避唎避唎(四)[合*牛](五)唵(一)鉢頭(二合)麼(二)紇(二合)唎娜野(三)母瑟徵(上四)[合*牛](五)唵(一)弭娑(去)羅弭娑(去)囉(二)薩縛摩爛(彈舌呼之)怛惹野(三)[合*牛](四)唵(一)弭馹(二合)臨(去音彈舌呼之)皤野(二)虎嚕虎嚕(三)[合*牛](四)唵(一)怏(於向反)矩舍(二)旖暮伽(上)迦唎灑野(三)[合*牛](四)唵(一)迦縛者野(二)覩嚕覩嚕(三)[合*牛](四)唵(一)旖暮伽(上)賞迦理(二)弭[口*履]弭[口*履](三)[合*牛](四)唵(一)旖暮伽(上)振跢麼抳(二)覩徵(上)覩嚕(三)[合*牛](四)唵(一)旖暮伽(上)播抳(二)旨理旨理(三)[合*牛](四)唵(一)跋馹囉(二)覩旨旨[口*(隸-木+士)](三)[合*牛](四)唵(一)旖暮伽(上)紇(二合)[口*履]那野(二)柘囉柘囉(三)戍(輸律反下音同)陀(上)薩埵(四)[合*牛](五)唵(一)旖暮伽(上)縛底(二)旨智旨智(三)[合*牛](四)唵(一)苾[亭*夜]渴誐(二)瞋娜野設咄[口*輪](三)[合*牛](四)唵(一)窒(二合)[口*履]曼拏攞(二)播[口*履]戍悌(三)避智避智(四)[合*牛](五)唵(一)素嚕素嚕(二)[合*牛](三)唵(一)麼抳麼抳(二)[合*牛](三)唵(一)補澁波(二)縛底惹野(三)[合*牛](四)唵(一)步地只跢播捨(二)陀(上)羅陀(上)羅(三)[合*牛](四)唵(一)鉢頭(二合)麼播捨(二)毘輸(去)悌(三)[合*牛](四)唵(一)跋馹囉播苫(二)皤縛覩(三)畝嚕畝嚕(四)[合*牛](五)唵(一)振跢麼抳播捨(二)縛囉泥(三)[合*牛](四)唵(一)斫羯(二合)囉播捨(二)旖素囉[寧*吉](寧吉反)伽(上)跢迦(三)度嚕度嚕(四)[合*牛](五)唵(一)窒(二合)[口*履]輸(去)理播捨(二)弭路迦耶(三)跢囉耶(四)[合*牛](五)唵(一)那伽(上)播捨(二)滿陀(上)耶(三)羯侘野(四)訥瑟吒那伽(上)南(五)播捨播跢野(六)[合*牛](七)唵(一)惹路皤縛(二)那(去)囉那(去)囉野(三)[合*牛](四)唵(一)戰捺(二合)囉弭麼[口*(隸-木+士)](二)弭輸(去)陀(去)耶(三)陀(上)迦[口*藍]囉濕弭縛嚟(四)[合*牛](五)唵(一)菩陀(上)野(二)[合*牛](三)唵(一)弭惹野(二)補喇拏陀(上)[口*(隸-木+士)](三)[合*牛](四)唵(一)破路特(二合)皤髀(二)步唎[合*牛](三)唵(一)補(二合)喇拏漫拏[口*(隸-木+士)](二)惹野[合*牛](三)唵(一)娑(去)[可*欠](去)塞囉(二)囉濕弭(三)枳囉臡(四)[合*牛](五)唵(一)薩縛訥瑟吒(上二)跛(二合)囉[可*欠]囉(三)舍縒野(四)[合*牛](五)唵(一)摩怒弭輸(去)陀(上)野(二)麼攞弭麼黎(三)[合*牛](四)唵(一)補澁波縛底(二)素健陀(上)縛黎(三)[合*牛](四)唵(一)捨跢娑(去)[可*欠](去)塞囉(二)俁抳底(三)乞灑拏乞灑拏(四)[合*牛](五)唵(一)跋馹嚕乞使播(二)蘇旨目佉(三)旨智旨智(四)[合*牛](五)唵(一)旖暮伽(上二)跛(二合)囉底[可*欠](去)嚲(三)播捨歌悉羝(四)[合*牛](五)唵(一)薩縛怛(二合)羅畝伽(上二)悉[亭*夜](亭夜反下同)悉[亭*夜](三)娑(去)陀(去)野(四)[合*牛](五)如是蓮花手印三昧耶。
Suppose he always relies on this samaya one by one.
He'll memorize, recite, and observe the words accordingly.
He'll remove all the hindrances, the five heinous sins, and heavy crimes.
They'll be removed on their own and won't fall into a bad path.
Whatever deeds he does, they'll be accomplished.

source_sentence: 見不空廣大解脫蓮華曼拏羅三昧耶。
translation: He'll see the nonempty, vast, liberating lotus maṇḍala samaya.

source_sentence: 於當來世證趣阿耨多羅三藐三菩提處。
translation: In a future life, he'll realize the destination of unsurpassed, correct, and complete enlightenment.
He'll be the true son of Amitâbha.
He'll be born from the transformation of the Dharma.

source_sentence: 奉覲供養殑伽沙俱胝那庾多百千善逝如來。
translation: He pays respects and makes offerings to the sands, koṭīs, and hundreds of thousands of well-gone tathāgatas.
He amasses an innumerable accumulation of merit.
These are the tathāgatas.
They praise measurelessly the meritorious deeds.
He grants them all the distinctive marks of enlightenment.
It's the seal of all the buddha-holds, the seal of the maṇi-jewel, and the seal of the jeweled flower.
"The seal of the maṇi jewel, the seal of the jeweled flower, and the seal of the jeweled lotus flower.
The seal of the jeweled lotus flower, the seal of the jeweled pearl and flower garland, and the seal of the several pearls and the white conch.
It's a seal of the white conch sealed with several beads.
It's a seal of the five-colored conch, a seal of the precious gold wheel.
It's the seal of the iron spear with the [folded/itted] gall.

source_sentence: 獨股金剛杵印三戟叉印。
translation: He makes the seal of the three-pronged halberd with a single-armed vajra and the seal of the three-pronged halberd.
He makes the seal of the horizontal vajra and pounder with the seal of the bowl-shaped horn.

source_sentence: 金剛鉞斧印一底唎首唎印。
translation: It's the seal of the vajra axe, the seal of Yiddili Shouri.
It's the seal of the vajra pounder, the seal of the jeweled spear, and the seal of the long spear.

source_sentence: 羯摩金剛杵印如意珠印。
translation: "The sign of the karma-vajra, the seal of the wish-granting pestle.
"The seal of the great horizontal sword and the seal of the jeweled staff.

source_sentence: 羅矩咤印大自在天三叉戟印。
translation: The seal of the lakṣaṭa, the seal of the great self-penetrating god's trident.
He seals the sword and cord with the sign of the iron hooked dragon.
The sign of the red jeweled bead tree, sign of the turuṣka.
He seals the sign of the axe wheel and the sign of the axe gall.

source_sentence: 手出火焰印寶珠光焰印。
translation: He produces the seal of the hand-flame, the seal of the jeweled, luminous flame.
The seal of the five-colored light, the seal of the moha sarva, and the seal of the pounder.
The sign of the nūrā tree rope and the sign of the axe.
The seal of the auspicious vase with the sign of the ear drum.

source_sentence: 五色吉祥石印山樹石印。
translation: The seal of the five-colored auspicious stone, the seal of the mountain tree and the seal of the stone.
The seal of Mt. Sumeru, the seal of Pāṇḍu, and the seal of the dragon.
He seals the umbrella with the sign of the great banner.
The seal of the large fish and the seal of the small fish.

source_sentence: 龜印難儞迦縛跢左萬字相印。
translation: The seal of the tortoise, the seal of Nanni Kavana, and the seal of the left tally mark.

source_sentence: 苾[亭*夜]曼拏理印苾[亭*夜]印。
translation: The sign of the [bhūtti*yāna] maṇḍala, the sign of the [bhūtti*yāna].
The seal of the round-headed trident, the seal of the sword.
He makes the sign of the curved sword and the sign of the great lotus garland.

source_sentence: 窒[口*履]輸羅棄耶印暮巽抳鐵棓印。
translation: The seal of the iron gall of the udumbara [mouth*foot] śraśākya.
The seal of the nonempty tooth, the seal of the maṇḍala pārājika.
He makes the sign of the four teeth with the seal of Jambudvīpa.
The seal of the conch-wheel that meets the seal of Lakṣmī.

source_sentence: 三股金剛螺杵印兩股金剛螺杵印。
translation: The seal of the three-pronged vajra conch and mortar, and the seal of the two-pronged vajra conch and mortar.
The seal of the conch of pearls and the seal of the conch of lotus flowers.

source_sentence: 鄔刺頭縛鉢吒攞印師子頭口印。
translation: The seal of the lion's head and mouth, the seal of the lion's head, and the seal of the lion's mouth.

source_sentence: 命命鳥印迦陵頻伽鳥印。
translation: He makes the sign of the living bird, the sign of the kalaviṅka bird.
The sign of the bird of shared life, the sign of the ducks and geese bird.
The mandarin duck bird, the sarṣapa bird seal ...

source_sentence: 白鷺鳥印白鶴鳥印孔雀鳥印焰摩王棓印。
translation: The sign of the white heron, the sign of the white crane, the sign of the peacock, and the sign of the king of flames.
The seal of the four-faced god, the seal of the four-armored mirror ...
The seal of the trident and pennant, the seal of the jeweled vial, and the seal of the half-moon wheel, the seal of the sun wheel.
The seal of the half-moon wheel and the seal of the sun wheel.
The seal of the four lotus flowers and the seal of the three lotus flowers.
The seal of the ocean holding a flower in his hand.
The seal of the Brahmakāyika deerskin.

source_sentence: 五股金剛杵印商迦梨金剛鎖印。
translation: The seal of the five-pronged vajra and the seal of the vajra lock of Shangkali.

source_sentence: 妬囉拏金剛柱門印寶鉢印。
translation: The seal of the vajra-pillar gate of Jaladhara, the seal of the jeweled bowl.

source_sentence: 袈裟印迦佉羅迦錫杖印。
translation: The sign of the monks' robe and the sign of the khaṭṭaka's staff.
Mudrā, the seal of the Mīnāyanakīrtika.
the seal of the jeweled belt and the seal of the Cundaśaila.

source_sentence: 絡膊寶索印園林寶樹花印。
translation: seal of the necklace, seal of the grove of jewels and flowers.

source_sentence: 三斜角印普遍金剛杵印。
translation: The three diagonal signs are the sign of the universal vajra and the sign of the pounder.

source_sentence: 世尊此旖暮伽王廣大解脫蓮花曼拏羅印三昧耶。
translation: Bhagavān, this is the King Mūluka's vast liberation lotus maṇḍala seal samaya.
If you paint pictures, they must be colorful and vivid according to the teachings.
All of them must be colored according to the rules, and they must be clean.
Don't mix it with leather or plastic.
He should paint with color and seal.
Each will make it wonderfully beautiful, blue, and white in color.
Their appearance will be like birth.
He should touch and draw them one by one according to the rules of the altar.
They might be painted on white [pile*hair] silk or on a wall, board, or paper.
It's on a wall, a board, or a piece of paper.

source_sentence: 隨其一一大小壇量三昧耶。
translation: He follows the amount of samaya on each large or small altar.
He paints them as he wishes.
They can all make offerings.

source_sentence: 若常如法圖畫是廣大解脫蓮華曼拏羅。
translation: If he always draws this vast lotus maṇḍala of liberation according to the teaching, then he can make offerings to those who recite it.
Those who make offerings and recite it will naturally be freed from the ten bad qualities, five heinous crimes, and four grave offenses.

source_sentence: 自然除滅十惡五逆四重等罪。
translation: He'll naturally be freed from the ten bad qualities, five heinous crimes, and four grave offenses.
He'll attain the Avalokitêśvara Bodhisattva's mudrā.

source_sentence: 教詔是陀羅尼真言法曼拏羅法。
translation: He teaches and instructs this dhāraṇī to be a true language and dhāraṇī to be a maṇḍala.
Some people may see this dhāraṇī and recite it.
He'll also cause the elimination of the hindrances of bad karma.
He'll also obtain all the buddhas in the ten directions.
I, Śākyamuni Buddha, and the other bodhisattvas and mahāsattvas.
I, Śākyamuni Buddha, and the other bodhisattvas and mahāsattvas.
They will all protect and protect their beloved son.
Therefore, wise ones should always apply themselves.
Truly accept and maintain it according to the cultivation of the Dharma.

source_sentence: 當令正獲不空王廣大解脫蓮花曼拏羅印三昧耶。
translation: He will then correctly attain the royal lotus maṇḍala seal samaya of Amoghapāśa's vast liberation.

source_sentence: 不空羂索神變真言經卷第四
translation: Bukong juansuo shenchang zhenyan jing, vol. 4
